title: Veten Mountain
text: Veten Mountain () is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> about 2 nautical miles (3.7 km) northwest of <a href="Hogskavlen%20Mountain">Hogskavlen Mountain</a> in the <a href="Borg%20Massif">Borg Massif</a> of <a href="Queen%20Maud%20Land">Queen Maud Land</a>. It was mapped by Norwegian cartographers from surveys and air photos by the <a href="Norwegian-British-Swedish%20Antarctic%20Expedition">Norwegian-British-Swedish Antarctic Expedition</a> (NBSAE) (1949–52) and named Veten, meaning "the beacon."
